metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:file_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:file_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that a file_object with a path is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path pattern match is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path and filename is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path pattern match and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported in the 'up' direction.
Test that the windows_view behavior is supported and can collect information from the '32_bit' view.
Test that the windows_view behavior is supported and can collect information from the '64_bit' view.

file_test.comment: Test that a file_object with a path is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path pattern match is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path and filename is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that a file_object with a path pattern match and filename pattern match is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported in the 'up' direction.
Test that the windows_view behavior is supported and can collect information from the '32_bit' view.

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: Please note that windows_view behavior only applies on a 64-bit system. If this test is run on a 32-bit system, it should fail because there will only be one instance of the file and it will have the same size as itself.

file_test.comment: Test that the windows_view behavior is supported and can collect information from the '64_bit' view.

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: Please note that windows_view behavior only applies on a 64-bit system. If this test is run on a 32-bit system, it should fail because there will only be one instance of the file and it will have the same checksum as itself.

file_object.comment: Retrieve file object with path equals 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer'.
Retrieve file object with path that matches '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*'.
Retrieve file object with path equals 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and filename equals 'iexplore.exe'.
Retrieve file object with path equals 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and filename that matches '^i.*'.
Retrieve file object with path that matches '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*' and filename that matches '^i.*'.
Retrieve file object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files', recursing down 1 level, and filename equals 'iexplore.exe'.
Retrieve file object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files', recursing down infinitely, and filename equals 'install.ins'.
Retrieve file object with path starting at 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\SIGNUP', recursing up 1 level, and filename equals 'iexplore.exe'.
Retrieve a registry_object with a path equal to 'C:\Windows\System32' and a filename equal to 'cmd.exe' from the 32-bit view of the filesystem.
Retrieve a registry_object with a path equal to 'C:\Windows\System32' and a filename equal to 'cmd.exe' from the 64-bit view of the filesystem.

file_state.comment: This state represents a file which has a path of 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer'.
This state represents a file which has a path that matches '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*'.
This state represents a file which has a path of 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and filename of 'iexplore.exe'.
This state represents a file which has a path of 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and filename that matches the regular expression 'i.*'.
This state represents a file which has a path that matches the regular expression 'C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*' and filename that matches the regular expression 'i.*'.
This state represents a file which has a path of 'C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer' and filename of 'iexplore.exe'.
This state represents a file which has a path that matches '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer.*' and filename of 'install.ins'.
This state represents a file which has a path that matches '^C:\\Program Files\\Internet Explorer\\.*' and filename of 'install.ins'.

This state checks to see that the file 'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe' collected from the 32-bit and 64-bit views have different sizes indicating that two different instances of the file were collected..

This state checks to see that the file 'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe' collected from the 64-bit and 32-bit views have different checksums indicating that two different instances of the file were collected.

local_variable.comment: This variable retrieves the size of the file 'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe' retreived from the 64-bit view.
This variable retrieves the checksum of the file 'C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe' retreived from the 32-bit view.
